section.p: The Java2WSDL goal will generate a wsdl document from a Java class file that is WebSphere specific. The wsdl document will be created in the root directory.

Running the Java2WSDL task from the commandline is done using the following syntax:
mvn was5:Java2WSDL \ -DwasHome=<path to WAS> \ -Doutput=<mynewwsdl.wsdl> \ -DclassName=<fully qualified classname> \ -DimplClass=<fully qualified classname>
section.h2: Running Java2WSDL with definition in pom
section.p:
Running the Java2WSDL task with the definition defined in the build section of the pom:
<dependencies> <dependency> <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId> <artifactId>was5-plugin</artifactId> <version>1.0</version> <scope>runtime</scope> </dependency> </dependencies>
<build> <plugins> <plugin> <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId> <artifactId>was5-plugin</artifactId> <version>1.0</version> <executions> <execution> <id>generate-wsdl</id> <phase>pre-integration-test</phase> <goals> <goal>Java2WSDL</goal> </goals> <configuration> <output> mynewwsdl.wsdl </output> <className> no.dnbnor.portal.ws.ValutaKurserWS </className> <implClass> no.dnbnor.portal.ws.ValutaKurserWS </implClass> <wasHome> C:/Programfiles/WebSphere/AppServer </wasHome> </configuration> </execution> </executions> </plugin> </plugins> </build>
